issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description: Javascript can't handle 64-bit integers natively, so writing them as strings in the JSON would make implementing the integration tests a lot simpler.
fields.summary: [Java] Write 64-bit ints as strings in integration test JSON files

comments.body: Moving to 0.10.0. Should try to do this in the course of completing the JS integration tests (reading and writing)
[~paul.e.taylor] [~bhulette] how much work is this on the JS side? The C++ and Java side should be relatively straightforward

This should be pretty straightforward on the Javascript side too. It's not a major priority since we were able to workaround the issue using [json-bignum|https://github.com/datalanche/json-bignum], but it would be nice to drop that dependency.
OK. Let's take care of it in the 0.11 release cycle
Need someone to commit to provide timely help on the Java side before we can do this. I'm ready to do the work in C++ whenever it is required
[~siddteotia] could you or anyone help with this on the Java side? I don't think this should be a huge project
[~pravindra] any chance someone on your end might be able to look at this? We'd also have to make changes in C++, so we probably would want to create a branch where we can collaborate on this change
[~emkornfield@gmail.com] [~paul.e.taylor] any chance the three of us could collude to make this change? I can help with the C++ work if there is Java and JS work to happen at the same time
@wesm I should be able to fit this in for Java.  What timeframe were you thinking?
Anytime, doesn't need to be for 0.14
[~emkornfield@gmail.com] Not familiar with integration. Does this mean replace {{JsonFileWriter#generator.writeNumber}} with {{writeString}} for BigInt？
I would need to double check the code, but yes I believe it is in JsonFileWriter.  The idea is that javascript can better parse the longs as JSON strings then as JSON numbers.
We would also need to update the read path, and coordinate with contributors from the other implementations.

[~emkornfield@gmail.com] Thanks for clarify, what about I creating a new branch and invite people who are interested in other implementations to coordinate in Github (I can help with java side) ), once all implementations works done, we could get it merged.
(y) Nice! I submitted a PR for java side.
The java side to handle this change has been checked in, and is backwards compatible with the existing integration tests.  Thanks [~tianchen92]
